text: The Gothic novel is a genre of literature that combines elements of both horror and romance, typically featuring haunted settings, supernatural events, and an atmosphere of mystery and suspense. Emerging in the 18th century, the Gothic novel became highly influential in shaping modern horror and dark romance literature. It often explores themes of power, isolation, family curses, and human psychology, particularly fear and obsession. == Related pages == * Gothic fiction * Romanticism * Horror fiction * Gothic architecture * Dark fantasy == References == == Other websites == * British Library â€“ Gothic literature * https://www.gu Category:Horror
